thread.title: Record-breaking Jepchirchir returns to heroes welcome
thread.title_full: Record-breaking Jepchirchir returns to heroes welcome

title: Record-breaking Jepchirchir returns to heroes welcome
text:
Record-breaking Jepchirchir returns to heroes welcome Sunday February 12 2017 The New World Half Marathon Record Holder Peres Jepchirchir (left) is given Kalenjin traditional milk ‘Mursik’ by Albina Sitienei, on arrival at the Eldoret International Airport on February 11, 2017. PHOTO | JARED NYATAYA | NATION MEDIA GROUP In Summary World Half marathon record holder Peres Jepchirchir returned on Saturday evening to warm reception from relatives, friends and fellow athletes at Eldoret International Airport. Jepchirchir was handed Kalenjin traditional milk mursik upon arrival. Jepchirchir, who lowered the world half marathon record of 1hour,05:09min which had been set by Florence Kiplagat to 1:05:06, said she was prepared to break the course record on Friday during RAK Marathon in the United Arab Emirates. Advertisement More by this Author 
World Half marathon record holder Peres Jepchirchir returned on Saturday evening to warm reception from relatives, friends and fellow athletes at Eldoret International Airport. 
Jepchirchir was handed Kalenjin traditional milk mursik upon arrival. Jepchirchir, who lowered the world half marathon record of 1hour,05:09min which had been set by Florence Kiplagat to 1:05:06, said she was prepared to break the course record on Friday during RAK Marathon in the United Arab Emirates. 
“I was going for the course record and I didn’t know that I would break the world half marathon record that was held by Florence Kiplagat. I’m very happy and this is a good sign for me in the coming days,” said Jepchirchir. 
“I’m still young and I will be looking forward to getting more titles in road races and the marathon races,” she said. 
The athlete who trains in Kapsabet in Nandi County, added that she looks forward to competing in a marathon race next week. 
“My preparations for marathon started on time and that is why I was able to do well in the United Arab Emirates. It (Friday’s performance) has really given me motivation going forward. 
I didn’t know that one day I will be a star,” said the world half marathon record holder.
